intro: Pervillaea brevirostris, commonly known as the short-beaked pervillaea, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads and often hairy foliage. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, thriving in well-drained soils. Its small, daisy-like flowers are usually yellow or pale green, and it produces small, elongated fruits. Pervillaea brevirostris is adapted to withstand drought and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats.
